text: I am here in Brooklyn in beautiful snowy
Prospect Park to talk with Bobby and

oscar-nominated composers of the musical

is kind of where you came to get some

eternal winter we would sometimes ask
Disney for pictures just to inspire us
but this in this case it was just taking
a walk in our own backyard basically
that that kind of put a picture in our
head and and allowed us to kind of like
improv
so this is your home in Brooklyn and
this is where you collaborate on some of
your musical ideas that you on
everything really collaborate on
marriage Parenthood music what are we
gonna wear what are we gonna eat so when
you guys came on to frozen they had this
story this story about these two
princesses Elsa and Anna but they
weren't quite sisters and their
characters were not the same as what
ended up in the movie they were they
were still working with Elsa as the
villain and this and she really was very
you know vindictive against Donna
jealous and Anna was sort of more print
proper in order to make it a musical we
we thought that that it should be tilted
more in an optimistic positive direction
so that we could you know really get
behind the characters and and believe
that they would break out into song
slowly but surely that optimism and love
helped us guide or helped us find what
Elsa needed to be
there are definitely things in our life
that we were able to tap into this
emotion you know I know that that you
were coming from a place of an artist
who's a perfectionist I was coming from
a place as like a as a writer female

about what everybody thinks and trying
to be the perfect mom or wife or woman
Bobby you've been a part of really big
